pic1_alt: Map of the world showing energy use per person in 2021. Energy use is highest in the northern hemisphere and Australia and New Zealand and lowest in central Africa.
pic2_alt: Electricity production by source for the world from 1985 to 2021. Sources, in order of abundance, are coal, gas, oil, nuclear, hydropower, wind, solar, bioenergy and other renewables. All have increased almost linearly over time. There are dips in all in 2009 and 2020. Wind, solar, bioenergy and other renewables began around 2009.
